actions.text: Amendment SA 526 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 44 - 54. Record Vote Number: 83.

Amendment SA 526 proposed by Senator Murray for Senator Vitter. (consideration: CR S2311-2319; text: CR S2312) To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to ensure election integrity by requiring a valid government-issued photographic ID for voting in federal elections.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 526 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 44 - 54. Record Vote Number: 83.
Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 526 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 44 - 54. Record Vote Number: 83.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 526 proposed by Senator Murray for Senator Vitter.

purpose: To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to ensure election integrity by requiring a valid government-issued photographic ID for voting in federal elections.
